title: P86-1011

sentences.text: We examine the relationship between the two grammatical formalisms : Tree Adjoining Grammars and Head Grammars .
We briefly investigate the weak equivalence of the two formalisms .
We then turn to a discussion comparing the linguistic expressiveness of the two formalisms .

Entity-the_weak_equivalence_of_the_two_f.description: The relationship between Tree Adjoining Grammars and Head Grammars, characterized by similarities in their linguistic expressiveness.

mentions.local_name: a discussion comparing the linguistic expressiveness of the two formalisms

Entity-the_linguistic_expressiveness_of_.label: the linguistic expressiveness of the two formalisms

Entity-the_linguistic_expressiveness_of_.description: The degree to which Tree Adjoining Grammars and Head Grammars can generate and describe natural language structures, including their ability to capture nuances in meaning and syntax.

Entity-linguistic_expressiveness.description: The ability or capacity for language to convey meaning, emotion, and complexity.

Entity-formalism.label: formalisms
Entity-formalism.description: A set of mathematical rules or conventions used to describe a particular system, process, or concept.

Entity-relationship.label: relationship
Entity-relationship.description: A connection or linkage between entities, concepts, or systems.

summary: We examine the relationship between the two grammatical formalisms : Tree Adjoining Grammars and Head Grammars . We briefly investigate the weak equivalence of the two formalisms . We then turn to a discussion comparing the linguistic expressiveness of the two formalisms .

Predicate-and.label: and
Predicate-and.description: The predicate 'and' connects two entities or concepts to indicate a relationship of conjunction, equivalence, or similarity between them. It suggests that both subjects are related and share common characteristics, properties, or features.

Predicate-investigate.label: investigate
Predicate-investigate.description: To investigate means to systematically examine or analyze something in order to gain a deeper understanding, uncover hidden patterns or relationships, or verify its validity. The subject takes on the role of an investigator who actively seeks out information and evidence to support their inquiry.

Predicate-discussing.label: discussing
Predicate-discussing.description: The predicate 'discussing' indicates that the subject (in this case, a discussion) is engaging with or exploring the object (the linguistic expressiveness of the two formalisms), often in an analytical or critical manner. This connection implies a thoughtful consideration and examination of the object's aspects, features, or implications.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is subsumed or encompassed by the object concept. In other words, it suggests a hierarchical relationship where the subject is a specific instance of the more general category represented by the object.
